H0.text: Because the batteries conduct the electricity, the flashlight worked after Norma replaced the old batteries with new ones.

H1.text: Because the batteries supply the energy, the flashlight worked after Norma replaced the old batteries with new ones.

H2.text: Because the batteries produce light, the flashlight worked after Norma replaced the old batteries with new ones and it turned on.

H3.text: Because the batteries produce heat, the flashlight worked after Norma replaced the old batteries with new ones, turning it on.

A4.text: When a battery is connected to an external electric load, those negatively charged electrons flow through the circuit and reach the positive terminal

A5.text: Batteries are designed so that the energetically favorable redox reaction can occur only when electrons move through the external part of the circuit

A6.text: An active network contains at least one voltage source or current source that can supply energy to the network indefinitely.

A7.text: Active elements can inject power to the circuit, provide power gain, and control the current flow within the circuit.
